categories.name: Snacks
categories.description: Street-style favorites and traditional bites to kickstart your meal

items.name: Vada Paav
items.description: Mumbai's iconic food, a spicy potato fritter hugged by a pav (bun), with fiery garlic chutneys and a green chili on the side. Bold, messy, and absolutely addictive

items.name: Sambarwadi
items.description: A lesser-known Maharashtrian gem, flaky pastry pockets stuffed with a spiced mix of coconut, coriander, and gram flour. Think samosa, but sassier and way more flavour-packed.

items.name: Sabudana Wada
items.description: Crispy on the outside, soft and nutty inside, these golden fritters of sago, peanuts, and mashed potato are a fasting favorite turned full-time snack star

items.name: Dabeli
items.description: A spicy, sweet, and tangy mashed potato filling snuggled inside a Paav, loaded with crunchy peanuts, pomegranate pearls, and a secret chutney twist. Street-style magic from Kutch!

items.name: Mini Samosas
items.description: Crisp, golden pastry filled with a spiced potato and pea filling, seasoned with traditional Punjabi masalas. Perfectly bite-sized for your tea-time cravings or party platters. Served with sweet tamarind chutney for the perfect balance

items.name: Mini Shegaon Kachoris
items.description: Soft, flavorful kachoris filled with a gently spiced lentil mixture, inspired by the traditional Shegaon-style recipe. Served with sweet tamarind chutney for a perfectly balanced bite.
